programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to auctions in Santa Ana, and once back on familiar turf, Dave Hester makes the others fight for a decent locker.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys haggle over the price of a rare mandolin, a 1950s woodworking machine and the business card of a famous outlaw.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered puppets from Buffalo Bill's Wild West Show and a yearbook containing a letter bearing the signature of one-time US president Ronald Reagan.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The crew upgrades an electric car from the 1960s, and Rick is invited to throw the first pitch at a baseball game.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick needs to find spare parts for an alarm clock that gives the sleeper electric shocks, and also tries to turn a petrol pump into a sports locker.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Heavy snowfall leaves trucks backed up in high-risk avalanche zones, and with helicopters dropping bombs to shift the snow build-up, Jamie's team fights to get the traffic moving.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.desc: After Jarrett books a load of monkeys, he and Joe learn the true meaning of the expression 'never work with children or animals'. Meanwhile, Marc takes on a mysterious assignment for a Las Vegas magician.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.desc: Chris and Robbie convert their truck to run on vegetable oil, then make a risky attempt to make a deadline on the other side of the country.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Detectives investigate the mysterious death of a Chicago woman, whose body was found dumped on a Wisconsin highway in 1995.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: A ticket dispenser has a run-in with a person who is double parked while trying to rescue a stranded hawk, and a tow driver faces a tough time on the job.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Two officers are on the hunt for a clamped vehicle that has gone missing, and an employee deals with an angry man at the impound lot.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les's relationship deteriorates further as a string of problems in the warehouse threatens to bleed the business dry.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les discovers Seth's master plan for a new business structure at the Gold family pawn shop, leading to a huge stand-off between father and son.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank examine petrol station advertising and memorabilia, and stumble on an exciting piece of motoring history.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Actor Zachary Quinto hosts this reboot of the 1970s documentary series that explores the unexplained. He begins with a search for extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Investigating a theory that there was more than the previously alleged single UFO crash site in Roswell, New Mexico.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The crew upgrades an electric car from the 1960s, and Rick is invited to throw the first pitch at a baseball game.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick needs to find spare parts for an alarm clock that gives the sleeper electric shocks, and also tries to turn a petrol pump into a sports locker.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys snap to attention when a client brings in a rare West Point musket. They also get offered pilot licences signed by father of flight Orville Wright.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Items appraised include an antique electrotherapy kit, a 19th-century revolving cannon, a jukebox from 1973 and a 50-year-old electric waffle iron.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Too Many Cooks in the Locker
programme.desc: The buyers try their luck at auctions in Lancaster, where Mary chooses a surprising ally. Meanwhile, Jarrod and Brandi turn up the pressure.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave threatens to dampen high spirits at an early morning auction, and Mary struggles to stop the other buyers from getting her down.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les's relationship deteriorates further as a string of problems in the warehouse threatens to bleed the business dry.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les discovers Seth's master plan for a new business structure at the Gold family pawn shop, leading to a huge stand-off between father and son.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After forging carbon steel and wrought iron into a fully functional weapon, two finalists move on to create the uniquely curved Ethiopian Shotel.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos from Ancient Aliens investigates whether extra-terrestrial beings lie at the heart of some of Earth's most famous mysteries. Alongside experts, he explores the puzzling construction of Puma Punku in Bolivia, contemplating whether advanced technology could have been used to carve the ancient temple complex.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The sighting of a large boomerang-shaped object in Arizona after people witnessed a string of fiery globes on the same night in 1997.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zach sets out to research the strangest creatures from the depths of the ocean and to see how much they lend to the monsters of myth and legend.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: After his sacking, Rich returns to the shop in a last-ditch effort to win back his job. Seth continues his attempt to take over the store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An electric chair gives Rich the chance to get back in Les's good books, and Seth hatches a scheme that could make a fortune for the store.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers have big dreams of making it in Hollywood. Despite his hatred of Tinseltown, Dave takes a major gamble on an unusual locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to a first-class auction in Arcadia, but when bids quickly start reaching into the thousands, Mary is left struggling to keep up.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: North v South
programme.desc: Breakdowns and bad luck plague the bluefin tuna fleet, and as the small quota is rapidly filled, the pressure is on to catch before the season ends.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Fourth generation loggers the Bennet Brothers, Adrian and Neil, battle an inferno that’s destroying hectares of Tasmania’s bushland, threatening their business and their lives..

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: New employees Phil and Wayne face big problems, Al runs into trouble on a steep and twisting road, while Jamie and Adam race to re-open two highways.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Too Many Cooks in the Locker
programme.desc: The buyers try their luck at auctions in Lancaster, where Mary chooses a surprising ally. Meanwhile, Jarrod and Brandi turn up the pressure.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave threatens to dampen high spirits at an early morning auction, and Mary struggles to stop the other buyers from getting her down.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites satirist Charlie Brooker, presenter Scarlett Moffatt and actress Pearl Mackie to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include crocodiles, mosquitoes and having one's hair cut.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian Alex Brooker, journalist Jeremy Paxman and actress Sally Phillips to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include positive thinking, tourist attractions and former prime minister David Cameron.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Katy Brand, Ed Gamble, Suzannah Lipscomb and Amol Rajan join team captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe to answer questions about famous people who share the name Paul, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker. Sue Perkins hosts.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Ed Byrne, Angela Barnes, Geoff Norcott
programme.desc: Ed Byrne plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by Angela Barnes and Geoff Norcott.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: The return of the hospital comedy, starring Ed Easton. Simon resorts to desperate measures when Lucy tells him she's engaged to Dr McKenzie, while a new wheeler-dealer porter Anthony threatens Frankie's 'business' empire.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: When surgeon extraordinaire Mr Pradeep is put under Simon's wing for the day, disaster ensues just as a cosplaying Orc fanatic is admitted into the hospital.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force, featuring a hard-hitting mixture of body and observational footage, which reflect the daily challenges of combating crime and offer fresh insights into the fast-paced world of modern policing.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: At an old school drive-in, Mike and Danielle uncover a vintage reel of Beatles' footage that could be the only one of its kind.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Former boxer Brandon Bernier and his wife Lori take part in a bidding war for a locker full of alcohol.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon Bernier and his wife Lori discover voodoo dolls after buying storage units at auction in New Orleans.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys meet a former arms dealer and her judo champion husband, and make a killer back-room deal.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.sub-title: If You Talk Nice To Me
programme.desc: Mike is on a quest to buy a rare cycle car he has coveted for more than two years, but it is going to take a lot of luck and charm to seal the deal.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: A local sawmill operator lands a job clearing trees off a property in town and needs Corey and Collin's help to get his 1970 Massey Ferguson tractor up and running.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: When Old Man Winter blasts into Labrador without warning, a nearby Nordic Ski Club needs to get their rescue sled operational in a hurry.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. This edition also features a track test of the Danish Zenvo ST1 supercar and James Blunt returns for another drive in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson heads to Italy to get behind the wheel of the exclusive, hand-crafted Alfa Romeo Disco Volante, which is made by coachbuilder Touring Superleggera and based on the manufacturer's already rare 8C Competizione sports car. Richard Hammond asserts authority over the sand dunes of Abu Dhabi in the six-wheel-drive Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6x6, while James May defies his status as Captain Slow by blasting two Caterhams around the test track - the minimalist entry-level Seven 160 and the full-fat supercharged Seven 620R. Comedian Jack Whitehall sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: The owner of a dog sled team specialising in adventure treks needs a way to cart his huskies and sled all over Labrador. Collin and Corey customise a van to get the job done.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: A hunter wants her Daihatsu Hijet mini truck repurposed as a mobile hunting blind she can drive through the backwoods of Labrador in all conditions.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Police officers request a new police support unit or riot van, while a stolen car chase ends with an X5 wedged in a hedge. Boss Mick Sweetmore goes back to the floor with Merseyside's mental health team and discovers another side to modern-day policing - as well as the poor state of the vehicle they are currently using.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson subjects the Skoda Yeti to a thorough examination, while Richard Hammond charts the evolution of the Porsche 911 by pitting a modern Turbo S cabriolet against its oldest relative the Volkswagen Beetle - and the power of gravity. James May takes the Ariel Atom V8 for a spin on the test track, and comedian John Bishop receives tuition from the Stig before getting behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites satirist Charlie Brooker, presenter Scarlett Moffatt and actress Pearl Mackie to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include crocodiles, mosquitoes and having one's hair cut.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian Alex Brooker, journalist Jeremy Paxman and actress Sally Phillips to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include positive thinking, tourist attractions and former prime minister David Cameron.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Sue Perkins hosts a festive edition of the game show, which sees Jack Dee, Martin Kemp, Liz Bonnin and Suzannah Lipscomb joining team captains Josh Widdicombe and Richard Osman. As it's a Christmas special, however, there is a twist to the usual format - all the names are different, but every one of them is somehow related to Christmas.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Live at the Apollo Christmas Special
programme.desc: The BAFTA nominated comedy showcase returns for it's third annual Christmas special, welcoming some of the biggest and best comedic talent to the stage for some Yuletide frolics. Previous editions have featured stand-up routines and compering from renowned comedians such as Ed Byrne, Nish Kumar, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Henning Wehn. This time, Canadian comedian, writer and actress Katherine Ryan hosts the show, welcoming former I'm A Celebrity contestant and stand-up comic Joel Dommett, and Bristol-born comedian and radio presenter John Robins to the stage.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks to Mel Giedroyc and Noel Fielding, ultimately deciding who wins. Alex Horne helps coax the contestants.

programme.title: Sliced
programme.desc: Joshua and Ricky get invited to a sex party - on a council estate - and Naomi is rightly furious when she gets sent a rather saucy unsolicited gift in the post.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian Jimmy Carr, writer Steven Moffat and singer Rochelle Humes to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include sandy beaches, other people's opinions and being Scottish.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: An ageing confectionery company owner is found dead in his London hotel suite, and while Nikki tries to convince the sceptical DS Gold he was murdered, several businessmen begin to circle as it turns out the dead man was losing a desperate fight to prevent the sale of his company to investors. Feature-length episode of the crime drama, starring Emilia Fox, William Gaminara and David Caves, with guest appearances by Tim Pigott-Smith, Sharon Small and Priyanga Burford.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Evie's affair with the treasury minister hits the papers, while the shop is hit badly by the opening of Maison Gilles in London. Jack is attracted to the star of his latest film.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters are faced with the prospect of either selling up or accepting money from Lord Montford and Jack Maddox - an option neither is keen to contemplate.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice contemplates expanding the business, while an unexpected offer from one of Jack's old flames has bittersweet consequences. Starring Stella Gonet.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The company are put through a specialist training exercise, supervised by Veteran explosives expert, Sergeant Lewis. Starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave is court martialed after attacking an NCO in a jealous rage, and faces the possibility of being discharged from the army. Starring Robson Green.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane visits an Army hospital to instruct its surgical team on trauma techniques, and immediately takes a shine to a captain, but is also placed in a tricky situation after witnessing a soldier being abused. Back at Holby, Mubbs inadvertently disturbs Owen and Lisa's night of passion when he calls on his boss to help with an urgent operation. The surgeon gallantly obliges, but fails to mention the fact he is drunk, risking his career in the process. Guest starring Saeed Jaffrey.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gary hunts for Joe, desperate to find his fugitive brother before the vengeful gangsters get their hands on him, but dramatic developments make him wonder if he's been manipulated all along. Elsewhere, as Tony comes to terms with the enormity of what he's done, a witness comes forward accusing him of reckless driving, while Jim is moved to declare his true feelings for June.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Andrea fears her true identity as an undercover reporter could be blown when a journalist visits Sun Hill, while Jim decides to follow a psychic's advice and propose to June. Sheelagh is mortified to see her son arrested for a homophobic hate crime and Lance is furious at Adam for revealing he's gay, while Steve and Cameron find the dead body of a young thug - could he be the latest victim of Gabriel's vigilante campaign?.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon has some important news for Phil and Grant, and wants to get to them before the police do.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Eibhlin and John take stock of recent events, Grant finds himself in a tight corner, Hattie has a visit from her teacher and Michelle receives some good news.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: An accident on board a pleasure cruiser results in several people being hurt. Trevor installs a new system that exasperates the staff, while Laura and Ash argue about fund-raising initiatives and Baz tells Charlie the reason she is staying at a hotel..

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Eric gets involved with an Irish rock band, while Lovejoy takes to the water with Lady Jane's friend Victoria Cavero and bravely pops the question - only to receive an unexpected response. Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton and Chris Jury star with guests Joanna Lumley and the members of Hothouse Flowers.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: The son of an eccentric millionaire suspects his father's housekeeper is plotting to murder the old boy for his money. Jersey-set police drama, starring John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: The new shop is vandalised and Billy loses a vanload of organic vegetables. Aveline has left Oswald and arrives home with baby baggage.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: When sales figures are down along with the profits, Grace Brothers is forced to lay off staff. Mr Rumbold comes up with the ingenious plan that the employees themselves must decide who is fired. Classic British comedy, starring John Inman.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Social climber Hyacinth indulges another of her flamboyant whims and decides she and Richard need a new car - but a modest three-door hatchback is not what she had in mind. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Miraculous Curing of Old Goff Helliwell
programme.desc: When Clegg, Billy and Truly hear an old school friend is about to die, the trio search for something - or someone - to put the spark back into his life. Comedy, guest starring Henry McGee, with Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Keith Clifford.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: The detective investigates the meticulously planned murder of an elderly birdwatcher, and begins to suspect that he is on the trail of a vengeful serial killer. However, the case is jeopardised when he becomes too close to one of the key suspects. Drama, starring Kenneth Branagh, Sarah Smart, David Warner, Tom Hiddleston, Saskia Reeves and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: In a special edition of the detective drama that features only two members of the team, Gerry Standing and Steve McAndrew travel to Glasgow, where a new Ucos section is being set up. While there, they agree to assist the investigation into the 1993 unsolved murder of James Soutar, the wealthy owner of a string of betting shops. Cathy Sinclair, one of the beneficiaries of the bookie's will at his death, had a care-home upbringing in common with Soutar, but she claims to have no idea who he was or why she was left £15,000. McAndrew has a personal stake in the case - the original investigating officer was corrupt cop Frank McNair, who had an affair with his wife, and their paths soon cross. The London-based officers' questions begin to unsettle someone and a campaign of victimisation against them begins, but it's a revelation from McAndrew's girlfriend Charley that reawakens a long-dormant scandal and clears the path to a solution. Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is baffled by the conflicting possible motives after two women are shot dead in a house basement - and the investigation isn't helped by Jack having to work alongside an old flame, the ambitious DI Chrissy Reed. Meanwhile, Leo faces a difficult choice when he is asked to prove his pathologist mentor made a mistake in a case that resulted in a mother being imprisoned for smothering her baby to death. Emilia Fox, William Gaminara and David Caves star.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Piers meets Caitlyn Jenner, who for the first 65 years of her life was known as Bruce, a former Olympic gold medal-winning decathlete. Looking back at her remarkable life, she opens up about her feud with her ex-wife and stepchildren in the Kardashian family, reflects on winning Olympic gold while simultaneously battling gender issues and discusses the death of her younger brother.

programme.title: The Level
programme.desc: Nancy's personal and professional lives collide when she sees a connection between her mother and the missing truck, as the full extent of Frank's monstrous crimes becomes clear, and she is forced to operate outside the law to prove her case against Nash. Hayley is let down by her ex-husband, leading Quinn to offer some much-needed comfort that provides food for thought, while Cherie doesn't seem to want to face the truth when Hayley asks her some probing questions.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson helps people in Manchester sort the treasures from their trash, including a mid-century clock, an antique revolver, and a portrait of a sleepy subject.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar in which players four contestants can accumulate big cash totals by answering questions in a series of rounds that alternate between easy and hard, before one gets to the final stage and the chance to double the prize pot.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Brexit Party.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: The STV Leaders' Debate
programme.desc: Nicola Sturgeon, Richard Leonard, Jackson Carlaw and Willie Rennie, Scottish party leaders for the SNP, Labour, Conservatives and Liberal Democrats, go head-to-head in a General Election debate chaired by STV's political editor Colin Mackay.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the celebrity survival challenge, which sees a group of famous faces living in the Australian jungle, struggling to complete the tough daily tasks and dreaded Bushtucker Trials. The campmates are tired, hungry and homesick, but need to keep winning stars - and food - if they are going to make it to the end.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: The presenter introduces a guide to this year's must-have toys, and Leicester City striker Jamie Vardy and his wife Rebekah join five families in trying out the latest board games. Phillip competes against racing driver Billy Monger in a remote control car road test, Stacey Solomon checks out fancy dress costumes for children, and children recommend presents under £15.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The rounding up of escaped pythons in Florida, the making of Panama hats, and how drivers are kept safe in the world's longest tunnel.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a bargain Range Rover P38 and mechanic Edd China sets about mending it. They then take the car to Exmoor for a final test drive before looking for a buyer.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini hopes a fishing rod and canoe will add to the value of his 1939 Ford Standard Woodie Wagon.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini sells four cars at auction in Kissimmee, Florida, but fears they will become lost in a crowd of 2,000 lots.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: A comedic complication of some of the most outrageous and dangerous misadventures on wheels. From faulty designs to stunts gone wrong, the crazy real-life footage is endless.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Terrifying Tornado, Free-Fall Fireball, Molten Metal
programme.desc: Footage of everything from human endurance and survival to calamitous engineering failures, including a devastating natural disaster.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Bodies and motorcycles hurtle through the air after a high-speed crash, and tanks holding 15,000 gallons of crude oil explode after being struck by lightning.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A stunt driver is crushed by his all-terrain vehicle after a backflip goes wrong in Mexico, and a fire turns a 32-storey Madrid high-rise into a ruin.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: Goodson All Terrain faces another financial problem when one of its buyers cancels all future orders of hardwood.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and his team restore the 1965 VW Bug of a fellow mechanic, whose bad health has halted his project.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The safety systems used by racing drivers to help them survive crashes at speeds of up to 300kph, plus the processes involved in the manufacture of impregnable bank vaults.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: A look at how the Viking lander may have found life on Mars. Plus, a starship is supposedly spotted in the aurora borealis, and Nasa's mysterious moon pigeons are explained.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The start of the potentially lucrative opilio crab season sees 171 boats heading out from Dutch Harbour, Alaska, to hunt them for profit. But shortly after setting off, the Lady Alaska crew discovers smoke on the vessel, forcing Captain Peter Liske to turn around and seek repairs. Meanwhile, companion boat the Big Valley is beset by troubles of its own.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The final week of gold season arrives, and the Dirt Dogs gamble big to hit their target. Meanwhile, Kellie and Henri mount a last-chance hunt.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Turbo embarks on a journey through an area affected by bush fires, and Yogi faces the biggest week of his career.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: The duo relocate across the Atlantic, and Mike Brewer heads to Chicago in search of a rust-free Pontiac GTO - a rare car that he knows will be perfect for kicking off Edd China's US-based workshop.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini travels to Ohio to buy a Pierce Arrow, but is forced to pull out of the purchase when the owner backtracks on his decision to sell.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini rescues a Jaguar 120 after a recluse's car-collecting becomes a hoarding habit.

programme.title: Mysteries of the Missing
programme.desc: Terry O'Quinn investigates the disappearance of a huge cargo ship crewed by 27 people, and explores new evidence that suggests it may have vanished as the result of a rogue wave.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: In South Australia, rookie miners Daniel Becker and Justin Lang leave their lives behind, risking all to chase an opal fortune.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: When the Big Valley sinks, good Samaritan boats such as the Maverick scour the icy waters for survivors. News of the tragedy travels fast, and boats out at sea debate whether to continue fishing. Tragedy strikes again when a deckhand falls overboard - striking a nervous chord with even the most experienced seamen.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Four crews rush to clean out the Tomcod claim, and a gold war ensues. Meanwhile, Captain Emily Riedel and her new diver face a battle of their own.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to Devon, where he finds a wealth of unusual oddities housed in a country pub. He moves on to Hastings, East Sussex, which has enjoyed a recent resurgence in the antiques trade.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Turbo gambles his truck, not to mention his life, by taking a route through devastatingly tough terrain. Meanwhile, Yogi races to beat a vital deadline on a make or break job.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a bargain Range Rover P38 and mechanic Edd China sets about mending it. They then take the car to Exmoor for a final test drive before looking for a buyer.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie miners Justin and Daniel tread a dangerous path deep underground in an abandoned mine. Meanwhile, Kelly and Al search for a rare, valuable black opal.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Macclesfield, Cheshire, Drew Pritchard meets a mother-and-son team. Later, in Leeds he catches up with a young dealer with an eye for modern pieces.

programme.title: Aircrash Confidential
programme.desc: Planes are an ideal terrorist target, carrying hundreds of potential victims and assuring worldwide publicity. How can new technologies stop hijackers getting on board?.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Mike and Valerie crash a high-stakes poker game to discover the location of a jet, while Ken and Danny hunt down the luxury yacht belonging to a so-called 'womaniser'.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction of working miniature airports, the design of houses to withstand hurricanes and the cultivation of rhubarb in the dark.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The way billions of bees help produce tons of California almonds, how snow is cleared to keep planes functional in Norway, and the removal of tricky stains.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.desc: In the 1980s and '90s, there were around 200 murders and attacks on sex workers across the Midlands. Stafford man Alun Kyte was later found to be responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How murder investigation experts reconstruct crimes from the remains of burnt evidence when the body of the victim has yet to be identified.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of nursing student Michelle Le, whose body was found in a remote Californian canyon four months after she disappeared in May 2011. Giselle Esteban was later found guilty of murdering the 26-year-old after she became jealous of her relationship Le had with the father of her child.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Missouri farmers Charles and Grace Lewis, who were killed in September 1993. William Rousan was later found to have masterminded their murder as part of a plot to steal their cattle, assisted by his teenage son Brent, and his brother Robert.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How investigators came to suspect that the perpetrator of a sophisticated string of Chicago bank robberies could be a policeman.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: A look at the impact of Phoenix's location in the Sonoran desert, as well as how it affects the animals that live there.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown heads to the Halls Gap Zoo in Victoria, where Stephanie the lemur is suffering with an infection in her tooth that could become a major problem if not fixed.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Britanny shops with her uncle, who insists her dress has lots of sparkle, while Nicole finds her father is eager to please.
